subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank Sumption and Bill Murphy on Darkness Radio- 	links for download
author: David Koenig
full_text:
That's what I'm talking about!I thought the show was almost Perfect!Great
recordings .. Are these on your site?(If you have one)
Or just here?
Thanks
Dave

On Mon, Aug 3, 2009 at 10:08 PM, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...> wrote:

>
>
> I think you all did a great job and the samples you used were good examples
> whether ya said what they were or not. Radio hosts tend to want their show
> to run their way and for their guests to follow their planned itinerary. If
> people dont like that go start your own show, do it your own way. It wasnt a
> science experiment it was a talk show. With any evp method it comes down to
> one simple idea, that is to try it yourself and get your own results and
> prove it or disprove it for ones own self. Everyone may not agree with what
> you hear but its not an ego contest (for most) for who can get the best evp
> its about learning theres more out there than what is visible to the naked
> eye and sharing your experience with others so that they too can try it for
> themselves. There are many methods and tools for communication and anyone
> who wishes to learn more can do so on their own.
>
> Like Debbie said you either believe it or you dont. You either want to try
> for yourself or you dont. It isnt up to us to prove or disprove the validity
> of it, it's up to you the individual to come to your own conclusions for
> your own tests and your own experiements. There are people who run around
> all day yelling I saw a UFO but until you see one for yourself you may just
> think they are nutcases. Even if you see one you still may not believe it.
> That is your decision to make. We cant make it for you.
>
> Misty
>
> --- On *Mon, 8/3/09, psi_research <vilhellm@sbcglobal.net>* wrote:
>
>
> From: psi_research <vilhellm@...>
> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank Sumption and Bill Murphy on Darkness Radio-
> links for download
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Monday, August 3, 2009, 5:22 PM
>
>   Hey thanks to Steve Hultay and the rest of the team for providing many
> of the files. In response to Rick, it was the desire of Frank and myself to
> play the audio samples WITHOUT providing the name of the file to allow the
> listener to make up their own mind. In fact, I specifically made a written
> request to the radio show which was copied to Frank on this and the reasons
> why. Their response was this wasn't a blind evaluation of communication but
> rather a radio show meant to introduce Frank and his pioneering work in a
> personal way to the audience and allow listeners to hear swept tuned device
> files. It wasn't the proper forum for an indepth study, it was meant to be a
> virtual meet and greet between Frank and the Darkness Radio listeners. -Bill
> Murphy
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com<http://us.mc329.mail.yahoo.com/mc/compose?to=EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>,
> "Rick" <rasterer@.. .> wrote:
> >
> > Unfortunately, the examples used were problematic.
> >
> > You might notice they either played the EVP, then told the audience what
> the they were supposed to hear, and then played it again. Or told the
> audience what they were supposed to hear first. They never just played the
> sound (without the leading questions), and gave the audience some time to
> decide what it was saying on their own.
> >
> > So while the history at the start was interesting, all the examples were,
> sadly, more examples of how people can fool themselves with pareidolia, than
> examples of spirit communications.
> >
> >
> > Note also, this also explains why prerecording noises, and using them
> later for the source of a Q/A session, still works. It's a tricky
> explanation when trying to explain how spirits are 'changing' the sounds at
> session time. But it is an easy explanation that it wouldn't matter whether
> the sounds were live or recorded, if it was just people hearing what they
> wanted to hear.
> >
> > I realize that many people aren't out to prove anything, and that's fine:
> but in this case, it seemed a point of the interview was to demonstrate the
> efficacy of the box. In this case it would be better to either state they do
> not expect their examples to be prove anything, or if they expect to
> convince an audience, to use better testing of their results, and less
> leading of the audience.
> >
> > imho
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com<http://us.mc329.mail.yahoo.com/mc/compose?to=EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>,
> Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@ > wrote:
> > >
> > > I agree with Shane. That was a great talk Frank S and Bill M.! I'd also
> like to thank Steve and Kristin for sharing some of your EVP results with
> them to use on the show. Those were some good examples of Frank's box and
> the sweep tuning method.
> > >
> > > I love it when people in this group work together towards our common
> goal. It's a wonderful example of teamwork and treating this research (and
> each other) with honesty and dignity, instead of some of the egotistical
> lies and deciet thats being spread around out there. It helps maintain focus
> and a better perspective on this subject. Great job everyone!
> > >
> > > For those of you who missed the show you can download and listen here:
> > >
> > > MP3 Direct download link:
> > >
> > > Darkness Radio 8-02-09 Hr 1
> > > Frank Sumption the creator of the Franks' Box joins us for the first
> time tonight. Joining Frank is DarknessRadio' s Tech Talk Specialist Bill
> Murphy.In this hour we discuss one of the most popular and controversial
> paranormal investigative tools on the market, The Franks box; a spirit
> communication tool.
> > >

> > > Frank I'm laughing at your little buddy barking in the background he
> just had to put his two barks in hehehe. What a cute lil mascott!
> > >
> > > Misty
> > >
